intro: Lavoisiera marques-lisboana, commonly known as the Marques-Lisboana lavoisiera, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
